intro: Dysphania glomulifera, commonly known as clustered Chenopod, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species with nutritional and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its dense, clustered growth habit and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are usually succulent and adapted to conserve water, making it well-suited for harsh environments. Dysphania glomulifera is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator of soil salinity.
